intro: Geraniospermum multicaule, commonly known as the hairy geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom during the warmer months. Geraniospermum multicaule is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
